metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7163 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the opj_pi_create_decode function in pi.c in OpenJPEGallows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted JP2 file,which triggers an out-of-bounds read or write.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7163` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.1-1ubuntu0.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.1-1ubuntu0.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.1-1ubuntu0.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.1-1ubuntu0.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.1-1ubuntu0.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.1-1ubuntu0.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.1-1ubuntu0.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.1-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-1ubuntu0.1').
